The wooden doors of the Gambling Den's front entrance are propped open, allowing you to easily make your way forwards into the establishment. As you enter, you find yourself standing in a very large entrance hall. A sign hanging from the ceiling in front of you reads 'Welcome to the Gambling Den!', and from somewhere further within the building, you hear the distinctive sounds of laughter, conversation, and then of a slot machine dispensing coins to a lucky winner.

Although there only a few people loitering around in this entrance hall, the constant drone of chatter coming from up ahead lets you know that this place must be quite popular. As you start to walk forwards, intent on exploring the establishment, a voice suddenly calls out from your right-hand side, [axel.speech(Hello there! I haven't seen you here before!)]

Turning towards the source of the voice, you see a tall, muscular alligator-boy grinning at you. The scales covering his body are all a brilliant white, and as he comes to a halt in front of you, his pair of bright blue eyes lock onto yours, and he continues, [axel.speech(I'm [axel.name], the owner of this place, and I like to say hello to every fresh face I see!)]

[pc.speech(I'm [pc.name],)] you reply, returning the alligator-boy's greeting as he happily reaches out to shake your hand.

[axel.speech(It's a pleasure to meet you! Now, if you're looking to have some fun, you've come to the right place. We've got dice poker straight ahead down the hall here,)] [axel.name] says, pointing one of his clawed hands forwards, before turning it to the right and continuing, [axel.speech(and the slot machines are lining the main atrium down to the right there. If you continue on down to the very end, you'll find my good friend Epona, who runs our very special 'pregnancy roulette' game! You can get all the details of that from her.)]

[pc.speech(Thanks,)] you say, [pc.speech(I'll go and check it all out.)]

[axel.speech(Oh, and, erm, we've also got a shop,)] [axel.name] says, the friendly tone of his voice shifting into one of discomfort. [axel.speech(Roxy's the one that runs it. Just be careful around her, ok?)]

[pc.speech(Ok, I'll see you around,)] you say, letting [axel.name] hurry off to one side of the hall before moving off to explore the building.

Lining the walls of this vast hall are countless slot machines, in front of which sit the vast majority of the people in this area. Down the middle of the hall, numerous tables and chairs have been set out, and it's here that the rest of the establishment's patrons are drinking and playing casual gambling games with one another.

Although most of the slot machines are occupied, there are still quite a few which have been left vacant, and you could easily walk up to one and have a go, if you so desired.

In one corner of the Gambling Den's central atrium, several pairs of glass doors have been propped open to grant easy access to a huge, adjoining hall, which is dedicated solely to the immensely popular game of dice poker. At least fifty tables are scattered around the hall's floor, and although each one only seats two players, there are far more than a hundred people present, as around most of the tables, large crowds of onlookers have gathered around to watch ongoing games.

The hall is split into three sections, with each one decorated in copper, silver, or gold. The copper section is by far the largest, and from the nearby signs, you gather that these are the tables at which the betting is lowest. The silver section is roughly half the size of the copper one, and is a place where gamblers are willing to bet considerable sums of money on the outcome of their games. Finally, the gold section is the smallest of all three, and is reserved for players willing to bet huge sums of money.

Although the vast majority of tables are occupied, you can spot at least one in each section which has just one player sitting at it. If you wanted to, you could walk up to one of these tables and sit down for a game, or you could walk up to one of the nearby signs to read about the rules of dice poker.

Deciding to read the rules of dice poker before starting a game, you walk up to the nearest informative sign, and briefly scan over it...

[axel.name]'s Rules For Dice Poker
1. Both players place the buy-in amount to start a game. This is [style.moneyFormat(500, span)] for [style.colourCopper(copper)] tables, [style.moneyFormat(2500, span)] for [style.colourSilver(silver)], and [style.moneyFormat(10000, span)] for [style.colourGold(gold)].
2. Both players roll five dice each.
3. Players can choose to increase the bet (referred to as a 'raise'), or leave the bet at the buy-in amount (referred to as a 'call').
4. After betting is done, each player selects as many of their dice as they want to re-roll.
5. The players re-roll their chosen dice.
6. The ranking of each player's dice is compared to find the winner, who then takes all of the money in the pot.

Results ranking (from winning to losing)
1. Five of a kind: Five dice of the same value. (e.g. 33333)
2. Four of a kind: Four dice of the same value. (e.g. 55551)
3. High straight: Consecutive numbers starting at two. (e.g. 23456)
4. Full house: Two dice of the same value, plus three dice of a different, same value. (e.g. 22666)
5. Three of a kind: Three dice of the same value. (e.g. 44415)
6. Low straight: Consecutive numbers starting at one. (e.g. 12345)
7. Two pair: Two dice of the same value, plus two dice of a different, same value. (e.g. 55331)
8. Pair: Two dice of the same value. (e.g. 22415)
9. Runt: All dice of different values. (e.g. 13456)

If both players have the same ranking, the total value of the dice that make up their rank are compared. For example:
Player A: 33661
Player B: 22115
Although both players have 'Two pair', player A wins, as the total of their ranking dice is 18 (3+3+6+6), compared to player B's 6 (2+2+1+1).

If both players have the same ranking, and the same value, the game is a draw, and the money in the pot is returned to each player's hand.
